results.title: Meituan (3690): Market leader under pressure as competition rises and earnings visibility fades
results.section:
ting and Price Target
Key downside risks to our rating and price target include: 1) a worse-than-expected 
consumption environment; 2) a slower-than-expected narrowing of CGP loss; and 3) 
intensified competition for the in-store business. 
Key upside risks include: 1) a better-than-expected competitive landscape; and 2) 
faster-than-expected loss narrowing of new initiatives.

results.title: Meituan: NDR takeaway: Deep moat sustains despite near-term uncertainties
results.section:
ab
4 December 2025
Global Research
First Read
Meituan
NDR takeaway: Deep moat sustains despite near-
term uncertainties
We hosted an NDR with Meituan's  Head of Capital Markets Ms. Scarlett Xu and IR team 
today. Walking out of the meeting, while acknowledging near-term earnings 
uncertainty  given evolving competitive dynamics, we remain long-term constructive in 
Meituan's deep moat and solid consumer mindshare, as well as its differentiated supply-
side innovations (e.g. Raccoon Kitchen, InstaMart etc). Keeta overseas initiative  is also 
upside yet to be reflected in the price.
Competition: Signs of moderation; Differentiated supply-side innovations
Latest trends: Post Double 11, mgmt highlighted an industry-wide scaleback in user 
subsidies, supporting meaningful UE improvement. This has supported Meituan's food 
delivery (FD) volume share recovery over the past 2 months, which mgmt anticipates 
continued momentum as competitors further reduce subsidy, especially for low AOV 
orders. Mgmt reaffirms Meituan's strategy to focus on core and high value users, with 
orders of net AOV above Rmb15/30 (representing profitable transactions) reaching 
c67%/70% GTV market share. Looking ahead, mgmt emphasizes the importance of 
refraining from re-entering the price war, instead opting to dynamically manage the 
pace of subsidy reductions for medium-to-high AOV orders. Sustained strength in 
lower tier cities. Mgmt is confident in Meituan's ability to maintain its dominant 
position in lower tier cities, noting BABA's prioritization of resources on higher tier cities, 
with more e-com users offering greater cross selling potential. Differentiated supply-
side innovations. Meituan continues to differentiate itself beyond pricing by focusing 
on supply side reformation, which peers may take time to replicate. For example, 
Raccoon Kitchen (a shared central kitchen infrastructure for FD brands, enabling higher 
take rate from increased AOV and repurchases, and lower unit fulf

results.title: NDR and China Best Conference Takeaways
results.section:
M
 Idea
Meituan  | Asia Pacific
NDR and China Best Conference 
Takeaways 
Latest updates include  competition landscape, long-term food 
delivery/Instashopping profitability, and overseas updates. We 
prefer  BABA > PDD > Meituan > JD.  Maintain OW.  
Competition:
• Monthly trends: 2Q recorded 1.5 months of industry competition, while 3Q 
saw the full quarter impact, with  industry competition at peak, while recent 
trends have shown a slight pullback in subsidies. 
• Duration of quick commerce competition depends on peers, while aggressive 
subsidies (ultra low AOV orders) are not sustainable and unhealthy for the 
industry, especially for SMEs.
•  4Q is usually the low season with weather impacting beverage demand and 
fewer riders during winter, subsidies could be scaled back in 4Q theoretically 
for the industry. 
• Meituan currently maintains 70% GTV share for food,  confident of 
maintaining this in the long term.
•  Meituan will focus on membership and high-frequency users (core users 
account for majority of Meituan's orders). 
• Meituan's core advantage is in innovative product offerings, such as 
Pinhaofan and Shenqiangshou,  wide  offline retailer supply,  highly cost 
effective operational model, wide product selection,  affordable pricing high 
and delivery efficiency.
UE
•  3Q UE loss should mark the  peak vs 2Q,  as subsidies increased significantly 
in the industry and AOV decreased significantly.
•  UE gap vs peers  widened more than double vs  pre-competition at peak 
competition levels. Confident of maintaining UE advantage with better 
efficiency. 
Instashopping
• Current mix: Biggest category is medicine, while convenience store and 
instamart are also major categories.

results.section:
iterate their target to 
achieve 100mn high quality order volume with profit returning to a reasonable level 
in the long term. 
Competitive advantages for Meituan Instashopping
Management shared their competitive advantages for Meituan Instashopping 
which includes native instant retail supply chain which is different from traditional 
ecommerce and other logistics fulfillment such as half-day or next-day delivery. By 
digitalizing supplies and leveraging data insights, Meituan is more confident in 
meeting instant retail demand through continued infrastructure and service 
experience upgrade.
For example, Meituan has expanded its instant retail coverage to 24-hour 
convenient stores and pharmacy network, together with cold chain services for 
alcohol and other quality protection policies. 
Given that Meituan has already cultivated a group of loyal user base for 30-minute 
delivery through food delivery business, Meituan is able to bring highest conversion 
and incremental sales evidenced by stable market share and leadership position 
across all categories for Meituan Instashopping. 
Under an intensifying competitive landscape, Meituan will further deepen 
partnership with brand merchants to launch brand InstaMart for 24-hour instant 
delivery services covering warehousing, fulfillment and digital infrastructure. 
During double 11, there are hundreds of brands joining InstaMart with certain 
brands generating 3x higher in GTV during first date of campaign. Meituan will 
further upgrade AI service tools to provide more intelligent decision making for 
FMCG brands. 
Entering into 4Q25E, Meituan will continue to invest from supply side to ensure the 
best user experience and strengthen user education through double 11 campaign. 
As a result, management expects a wider loss for Meituan Instashopping in 4Q25E 
comparing to last quarter despite management’s confidence in medium to long 
term profitability target.

results.title: Quick Note - Meituan (3690 HK) (Buy) - Takeaways from management call
results.section:
we believe will likely lead to a more rational approach from all players. Besides, we 
believe there exists a possibility that Alibaba's (BABA US, Buy) competitive focus might 
shift to retail-related quick commerce which is the equivalent of Meituan’s instashopping 
business, as well as the integration of its quick commerce with its traditional ecommerce 
service. In terms of regulation, the regulators have provided verbal guidance against 
irrational competition, while we note no further concrete actions have been taken as yet.
Long-term market share and margin targets
Management expressed confidence in Meituan's competitive advantages in food delivery, 
citing its strong user base, high user stickiness, and a large proportion of mid- to high- 
frequency users. On the supply side, Meituan offers a comprehensive and cost-effective 
selection of restaurants across all price bands. The company's core competency also lies 
in its seasoned expertise to efficiently manage its nationwide riders’ network. Management 
is confident of maintaining its leading unit economics (UE) and targets a long-term profit of 
CNY1 per order, an achievable target which has factored in a more competitive 
environment. In the long run, management expects to maintain a 70% market share in 
terms of GTV in the core regular-meal category of the food delivery service business.
For retail quick commerce (RQC), management believes the total addressable market for 
this segment will be larger than expected and surpass CNY2tn by 2030E. Meituan is 
confident of maintaining its leader position in this segment. Management expects the UE 
of RQC to eventually exceed CNY1 per order, driven by a higher AOV, more brands, and 
higher advertising potential and a terminal GTV margin of around 2%.
In-store, Hotel & Travel landscape likely to remain stable
Management does not expect a significant disruption to the in-store business’ competitive 
landscape. While the Alibaba-owned map service, Amap, recently l

results.title: Meituan (3690.HK): Uncertainty on When CLC Could Regain Profitability; DG to Neutral
results.section:
e competition, maintain industry-leading 
delivery services and spend on marketing to strengthen brand awareness. 
Management will adjust the investment dynamically and is confident in unit 
economics recovery in the long term.
Strategy for on-demand retail business
Similar to food delivery, management believes selection, delivery and price are the 
top 3 most important things to differentiate from other market players. Given on-
demand retail is still in early stage of development, management observed more 
ecommerce players have ramped up their investments in on-demand retail sector. 
By now, Meituan has accumulated over 1mn retailers nationwide to provide 
consumers with access to nearly all offline retail categories. To further grow the 
supply, management has launched a lot of new supply formats, including tens of 
thousands of Meituan Instamart operating in many different categories to address 
unmet consumer demand from traditional supply. Meituan Instamart is now well-
penetrated in top and lower tier cities. Management plans to continue to deepen 
brand collaboration to explore offline inventory tailored to on-demand retail 
channels. 
Meituan will continue to create new consumption use case such as 24-hour 
pharmacy which is getting popular among consumers. Meituan also partnered with 
premium flower shops to meet high-end gifting needs. Meituan also offers 7-day 
return service for many categories to establish strong consumer mindshare for 
instant delivery within 30 min. 
Since Meituan Instashopping has already covered many ecommerce categories, 
such as 3C electronics, daily necessities, apparels, it further strengthens consumer 
mindshare during 618 campaign with average spending of top tier members being 
3x higher than entry level members while lower tier markets saw over 50% yoy 
growth. Overall, management remain confident in Meituan Instashopping’s growth 
rate in the next few years leveraging incremental demand capture as market 
expands.
Regardi

Leveraging its extensive 1P rider network and SuperBrain algorithm, Meituan  introduced

initiative has meaningfully boosted repurchases among core users. Meanwhile, its

and offering 88VIP membership benefits to drive engagement in non-food segment.

membership to boost lifetime value. It recently also ramped up promotion in its self pick-
up business.

results.title: Meituan (3690): Market leader under pressure as competition rises and earnings visibility fades
results.section:
il there is clearer evidence of a more predictable margin 
trajectory, a rationalization of competitive behavior in core food delivery, 
and a more disciplined framework for international expansion.
In food delivery, we acknowledge that Meituan still commands a majority 
share of mid- to high-price orders, but note that this leadership is being 
sustained against a backdrop of elevated competitive intensity, particularly 
from Alibaba. We see a growing risk that Alibaba could gradually gain 
mindshare among these more affluent and higher-frequency consumers, 
which in turn may drive wallet-share migration away from Meituan over 
the medium-to-long term. In our view, this risk rationalizes Meituan’s 
recent step-up in investment in membership benefits, which we interpret as 
a strategic move to defend and deepen loyalty among its core user base 
rather than a purely promotional tactic. We also highlight that Alibaba has 
been simultaneously enhancing 88VIP membership benefits, underscoring 
that the battle for high-value users is likely to remain a key front in 
China’s food delivery and local services landscape.
• Food delivery and InstaShopping: Worst is over but improvement 
may be gradual. Management highlighted improving industry 
competitive dynamics helping unit economics in 4Q25, and kept 
emphasizing its dominant market share for orders with higher average 
order value (AOV) which ensured better unit economics vs. peers. We 
believe Meituan will follow Alibaba's pace to scale back on price 
competition for food delivery, but it may be at a more moderate pace as 
Meituan may seek opportunities to take market share back selectively. 
We forecast Meituan's loss for on-demand delivery to improve from 
RMB19bn in 3Q25 to RMB16bn in 4Q25, and further to RMB18bn in 
2026.
• Instore: Competition still intensifying. CLC's operating profit dropped 
RMB29bn yoy in 3Q25, which we believe can’t be entirely driven by 
on-demand delivery, as ads/commission revenue growth s

Management believes there are fundamental differences between instashopping and traditional

supply in place ahead,  where Meituan has years of industry know-how. Hence these
investments will further enhance its leadership, and it anticipates a return to being profitable at
a reasonable level in the mid to long run.
In-store, hotel and travel (IHT) business GTV increased by high teens % yoy in 3Q, with high

leveraged AI to ensure the quality and reliability of its review ecosystem. Margin declined qoq
and yoy due to investment in 3Q, and management expects margin to be sequentially lower in
4Q due to intensified competition from Douyin and BABA.
Following these, CLC operating income turned negative for the first time since 2021 to -RMB

equity of 34.1%, cost of debt of 5.0%. Terminal growth rate of 
3.5%. Unless stated, our assumptions are unchanged.  
Our unchanged TP implies c14% upside and we maintain our 
Buy rating as we think MT’s competitive edge lies in its deep 
understanding and coverage of its sizable annual active 
merchants with direct business development team coverage, 
strong efficiency in route navigation and order distribution 
algorithms, and solid market share in lower tier cities and meals 
(or non-drinks). We think its continuous investment in the 
ecosystem will pay off in the long run. 
RMB counter: For the RMB counter (83690 HK, RMB90.75), 
our TP of RMB103.00 is converted from our H-share target 
price based on an end-2025e RMB-HKD of 1.11. 
Downside risks:  
◆ Intensified competition with BABA, Douyin

results.title: Meituan Q3: War does not determine who‘s right...
results.section:
in user incentives, but also continues to spend on RMB1bn a quarter on brand ads and membership benefits
(mirroring Taobao’s 88VIP programme). For the group, we model an RMB16.9bn loss in Q4, also incorporating RMB2.9bn of
New Initiatives loss. The latter incorporates a slightly larger sequential increase than in Q4 2024 when Meituan entered Saudi.
The fact Alibaba’s food delivery merchant app now has 75-80% of Meituan’s DAUs, compared with 50-60% before the
summer, aligns with our view that merchants will learn to multi-home as a rule… and must be somewhat alarming for Meituan
and believers. Meituan claims 70% share of orders over RMB30… while Alibaba occupied over 50% of the market for orders
below RMB15. Our bias is that as merchant supply becomes available across platforms, the relative gaps in AOV that exist today
will close. Alibaba for its part noted that increasing the share of non-beverage orders was one of the ways it was reducing food
delivery losses.
Hearing Meituan indicate a higher unit rider cost than Alibaba was… eye-opening. As the food delivery, quick commerce, and
core e-commerce markets continue to converge we expect competition between the platforms to be fought on the basis of
group-level balance sheet strength and top-down user traffic (in Alibaba’s case the Taobao and Tmall platforms, but also new AI
endeavours like Quark and the new Qwen app).
Summarising the key numbers
Group revenue. Meituan revenue of RMB95.5bn was +2.0% year-on-year, missing our estimate (RMB102.7bn) and Bloomberg
consensus on RMB97.5bn.
Core Local Commerce revenue. Core Local Commerce revenue of RMB67.4bn was -2.8% year-on-year, missing our estimate
on RMB74.1bn and Bloomberg consensus on RMB69.2bn.
Core Local Commerce operating profit. Core Local Commerce operating loss was RMB14.1bn, greater than our estimate on
RMB12.4bn and Bloomberg consensus on RMB12.6bn.

Netlist has appealed those rulings.On June 10, 2022, Netlist filed a patent infringement complaint against Micron, MSP, and MTEC in the U.S. District Court for the Eastern District of Texas (“E.D. Tex.”) alleging thatsixU.S. patents are infringed by certain of our memory modules and HBM products. results.section:
味之素等国际企业为代表的高端医药级氨
基酸技术与供应垄断。并购完成后，公司将正式进入欧美原料药市场，成为多家国际顶级
制药企业的核心供应商，进一步巩固其在全球高端氨基酸领域的领先地位。未来，公司将
以更开放的全球视野，积极布局新兴原料和高附加值功能产品领域，致力于从“氨基酸领
先者”迈向“全球生物智造生态构建者”，为中国生物制造业的高质量发展贡献更大力量。
⚫
公司是味精和氨基酸全球龙头，受益于行业格局逐步优化，同时搭建合成生物学平台，成
长动力强。预计 25-27 年归属净利润为 32.6、25.5、30.8 亿元。维持“买入”评级
风险提示
1、全球养殖需求不景气；
2、主要原材料价格大幅波动的风险。

事件描述 
公司于近日收到广东高院受理的由日本味之素株式会社提起的侵害专利权的《民事起诉状》等
文件，原告拥有专利号为201480005332.7 号、名称为“L-氨基酸的制造方法”的发明专利。
原告认为被告在味精的生产、销售过程中侵犯了原告201480005332.7 号的专利权，故向广东
高院提起诉讼：（1）判令被告立即停止侵犯原告200580

In these cases, the plaintiffs assert claims on the Company’s behalf against Mr. Siebel, our Executive Chairman, our chief financial officer, and members of our board of directors. Allthreecomplaints name the Company as a nominal defendant. Allthreeof the complaints seek unspecified damages to the Company, recovery of attorneys’ fees and other costs and expenses, corporate governance reforms, and other relief. On October 3, 2025, the cases were consolidated. On November 7, 2025, the cases were stayed pending resolution of theLiggettcase.As of the date of this report, the Company does not believe it is probable that these cases will result in an unfavorable outcome; however, if an unfavorable outcome were to occur in these cases, it is possible that the impact could be material to the Company’s results of operations in the period(s) in which any such outcome becomes probable and estimable. Due to the early stages of these legal proceedings, neither the likelihood that a loss, if any, will be realized, nor an estimate of the possible loss or range of loss, if any, can be determined.On February 27, 2024, the Company filed a lawsuit in the Court of Rome, Italy against Enel Global Services S.r.l. and any involved corporate affiliates (“Enel”). The claims in the suit against Enel include misappropriation of trade secrets under Articles 98 and 99 of the Italian Industrial Property Code and breach of contract. results.title: Melexis initiation of coverage - Niche automotive sensor leader with structural growth tailwinds
results.section:
zuhiro Takenaka, who bring Asia-Pacific expertise in response to the company’s regional sales profile (over 60%
of sales in APAC). Maria Pia De Caro and Shiro Baba are additional independent/non-executive directors. The board is supported
by Audit and Nomination & Remuneration Committees.
The board must include at least three independent directors, and all are appointed (or reappointed) for four-year terms by
shareholder vote. There are no age limits and Melexis maintains its tradition of gender balance at board level (currently 50/50
split male-female).
Notable board members & expertise
• Françoise Chombar: Chair since 2021, influential for both governance continuity and deep sector expertise (29+ years on
the board). Ms Chombar holds a Master’s in Applied Languages (University of Ghent). She is managing director of Sensinnovat
BV, Melexis's largest shareholder.
• Dr. Marc Biron, CEO since August 2021, is an electronic engineer and Ph.D. graduate from the University of Liège. He joined
Melexis in 2006 and led engine management and sensing programmes before becoming CEO.
• Roland Duchâtelet: Founding shareholder and long-standing non-executive board member, seen as a stabilising force and
significant owner of Melexis.
• Ling Qi and Kazuhiro Takenaka: Newly appointed (May 2025), strengthening international, especially Asia-focused,
dimension. Mr Takenaka brings over 45 years’ experience from Seiko Epson, Nissan, and broad cross-border industry
relationships.
Board independence and governance quality
Governance agencies (e.g. ISS via Yahoo) assign Melexis a middling governance score (as of November 2025: Audit 9; Board 8;
Shareholder Rights 5; Compensation 2 — lower is better). No major board-level controversies have been reported in recent years.
Mandatory ESG and audit committee structures are in place, and no regulatory or public reprimands or shareholder activism has
been noted in the past 24 months in mainstream Belgian or global press.
